Key Match Events: Max Schuemann and Lawrence Butler each hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning
Zack Gelof added a solo shot in the eighth
All-Star closer Mason Miller hung on after giving up two runs and four hits in a shaky ninth
Pre-Game Insights: The Reds, who have five starting pitchers on the injured list, figured to go deep into their bullpen on Tuesday
Post-Match Reflections: A's manager Mark Kotsay said, "When we’ve been behind where we haven’t scored first, we haven’t been very successful this season. It’s nice that we got a come-from-behind win tonight and finished it off."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Oakland has 162 home runs, which was tied with the Minnesota Twins for seventh in the majors. More than 50% of the runs for the A's this season have come on homers
Others: Oakland starter Mitch Spence allowed a run and five hits in 5 1/3 innings. He walked three and struck out three
Jakob Junis made his fourth start of the season, first since joining the Reds, and retired all 12 batters he faced with three strikeouts
Osvaldo Bido (5-3, 3.24 ERA) pitches Wednesday for Oakland. The Reds had not announced a scheduled starter.
